title: 107_s2221
content: There is no text provided in the prev_chunk, so I cannot generate a condensed text chunk for the curr_chunk. The text discusses the maintenance of Fiscal Year 2001 and 2002 FMAP levels for specific quarters in subsequent fiscal years, subject to certain conditions and provisions. The text discusses the maintenance of Fiscal Year 2003 FMAP levels for specific quarters in fiscal year 2004, with a general 1.50 percentage points increase through fiscal year 2004 for certain states. The FMAP for high unemployment states will be increased by 1.50 percentage points for specific quarters in fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. The FMAP for high unemployment states will be increased by 1.50 percentage points for specific quarters in fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. A state is considered a high unemployment state if it has an average seasonally adjusted unemployment rate exceeding the average weighted rate for a specified period. The average weighted unemployment rate is calculated by dividing the sum of unemployed civilians by the sum of the civilian labor force for a period. Medicaid payments to territories are increased for specific quarters in fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. The FMAP for certain territories will be increased by 6 percentage points under the Social Security Act. This increase applies only to Medicaid purposes and does not include certain hospital payments or payments under other titles of the Act. States are eligible for this increase if they meet specific criteria under their State plan. The FMAP increase for certain territories under the Social Security Act applies only to Medicaid and does not include hospital payments or payments under other titles of the Act. States must meet specific criteria in their State plan to be eligible for this increase. The eligibility under section 1115 of the Act must not be more restrictive than the plan in effect on October 1, 2001. Definitions for FMAP and State are provided in this section.
